reviews_data.review_text: Very good coffee and food. Staff is always so nice and the location is pretty chill and great for coffee meetups or doing some solo work in a great place. Love night swim

From a regular customer over the past couple years, I sincerely hope management considers this feedback. I'm not complaining for the sake of complaining, this shop is in a great location and the vibes are good, but it has some serious flaws that have me visiting maybe every other month as opposed to a couple times a week.

1. Everyone knows the prices are too high for the quality and amount you get. This is standard for the night swim/summit coffee industrial complex. The avocado toast being $9 on a small slice of sandwich bread is hilarious. The drinks only going up to 16 oz would be fine if a 16 oz drip coffee weren't $4.

2. They keep it absolutely freezing in here. When I do visit, this is the thing that always makes me leave earlier than I wanted to. I'm not exaggerating and as someone who's always cold, I'm used to it and always bring a sweater. Even in a sweater I'm cold here, and I look around and see all the women around me wearing sweaters and huddled up too.

3. The coffee is too acidic. Today there was a choice of the house blend or a single origin coffee and I chose the single origin. That was acidic too. All the coffees here separate with cream and that makes an unpleasant texture. If you're going to offer acidic coffee, it'd be great if there were also other options to appeal to a broader range of people. I'm convinced the people who say they like the coffee here are pretending for the sake of coffee snobbery.

4. The avocado toast is dry and bland. The extra seeds/topping on top adds to the dryness of the bread. I'd consider some sort of spread under the avocado and maybe add some pickled red onions/something for some acidity. Also pictured is the giant stem I got on my toast--girl how am I supposed to eat this?

First and last time today. First of all, you ripped me off on that quiche, that was the absolute smallest piece of quiche I've ever seen--fit for a toddler--and it wasn't even that good at all. You need to call it mini-quiche or it's complete false advertising, and you should be ashamed of yourself for that scam. Not sure how it took them sooo long to heat up that tiny piece that I finished my drink before it even came.  Also, you need bigger sizes than 16 oz iced drinks.....sad excuse for a coffee shop that only has one small size. And also you have a really small pathetic list of flavors for latte syrups. Good luck, you need it.
Why such small breakfast portions? Toast sandwich in a funny child size. Avocado toast has more pepper than avocado. Not tasty and not filling. I didn't like the food and the coffee was too hot.

Love the lattes and breakfast sandwiches on the brioche bun. Everyone who works there that I've dealt with has been very nice. I only ding them a star because they're pretty slow and it's very expensive.
I love the seasonal maple cardamom coffee really delicious and friendly staff
Amazing golden milk latte (with added espresso), coffee cake, and chocolate chip cookie. Atmosphere was a little small but still cute.
I had a latte and a coffee cake. They both were delicious.
They have to get a bigger machine. It took 15 minutes for a cortado? The place is cool. But man it's too slow.
The coffee was really good but you don't get much and it was $8 for like 12 oz

One of the best coffees available in town. The coffee beans they use are so well balanced and flavor-full, that I have been buying them my coffee machine at home and for family and friends overseas too. Would be a perfect day if their prices were also slightly easy on the pocket. This outlet has a great outdoor seating, if you wish to sip on a coffee and look at the sky or the seasonal garden visitors. Great flowers surrounding you too. All in all one of my best coffee experiences of the town.
Love the seasonal syrup flavors, especially the cardamom in the winter. Lightly sweetened lattes and a little quiche....nothing better.

I'm so thrilled when I found this coffee shop. I ordered a Tiramisu Latte with oatmilk(Spring Special menu)& Focaccia Sandwich. It was really good.
I will be visiting again with my kids in the near future. And the inside of the store was clean(even restroom) and the interior was simple and nice :)
Best Cappuccino yet! Loved everything about this place. Coming back soon.

The atmosphere and staff were pretty good. We ordered a cortado with chocolate and a tiramisu latte- both tasted like the espresso had been burnt which on the latte wasn't so bad but the cortado was undrinkable.
A very good cup of coffee
Great coffee and fabulous spot to meet up with a friend.

I got the matcha latte lightly sweetened with honey and oat milk. It was smooth, great presentation and not too sweet. The zucchini bread was moist, fresh and had cranberries. I have found a new favorite coffee shop!
The cookies are so good! Baristas were friendly, we enjoyed our coffee. Shop was clean. Parking lot was full and spaces were small which is my only complaint.
Great choice of beverages. Neighborhood feel . Excellent !
Great local coffee spot. I think they have the best lattes in town. You should definitely check it out if you like coffee and want to support a local business!

My new place! I stopped in one day because I didn't have enough time to make it to my other place. Guess I'm never going back to that other place! The coffee is amazing, the food is delicious and the people are phenomenal. I probably should have started with the people because they make all the difference. I'm convinced that my coffee is better because they are so kind.

A 16oz coffee is $4.06 with tax. I frequent many coffee shops around the city. This is by far, the most expensive but more importantly, it is not good quality. The process they use makes it taste gritty/over roasted.. Adding half and half does not help either. Also, cashless businesses should be avoided. Any business that removes options for you to pay are compliant in attempting to convert to a  digital banking/cashless society.(Already happening around the globe).  Night and Swim owners are good little compliant foot soldiers who are more than willing to do their part at eroding your  freedoms.

All of the baristas are incredible and friendly here! The atmosphere is awesome and super laid back but the baristas positive attitudes and insightful recommendations are what really makes it a great place to come and cozy up with a cup of coffee

My first time visiting today and the experience was wonderful. My daughter had bugged me about going for so long and I am glad I did. The avocado toast & the golden milk latte was delicious. My daughter loved it as well. I will definitely frequent this spot since I am in the area every week

Fantastic coffee! I don't even like Starbucks coffee anymore after having Night Swim!! Also if you can snag a slice, get the zucchini bread...it's sooo good. The atmosphere is very welcoming, easy to work in or socialize, nice patio and fairly quick service. Sometimes there is a bit of a line but it's worth the wait!

I recently had the pleasure of visiting this charming coffee shop, and it left a lasting impression. The atmosphere is perfect for work or relaxation, with just the right balance of ambiance and functionality. The fresh, flavorful coffee only added to the experience, making it an ideal spot to get things done while savoring a cup of Joe.

The barista and staff were not only friendly but also incredibly helpful, which enhanced the overall visit. Their warm service made me feel right at home, and I appreciate their dedication to ensuring a pleasant stay.

During my visit, I had the pleasure of trying both the hot Caramel Latte and the iced Caramel Latte, and I must say, they were both outstanding. The hot Caramel Latte was a delightful blend of rich coffee and sweet caramel, creating a warm and comforting beverage that was perfect for the cozy atmosphere of the coffee shop. The iced Caramel Latte, on the other hand, offered a refreshing twist with the same delectable caramel flavor, making it an excellent choice for those looking to beat the heat while sipping on something truly satisfying. These coffee creations only added to the overall appeal of the place, making it a must-visit for coffee enthusiasts and remote workers alike.

I can't recommend this coffee shop highly enough, especially if you're in the area. It's a gem that combines a welcoming atmosphere, great coffee, and exceptional service. Whether you're looking for a productive workspace or simply a delightful coffee break, this place has you covered.
Great coffee, great service
For a supposed premium coffee shop, their coffee is exceptionally bad.  Ive tried the drip coffee, iced coffee, americano, and the cold brew was the only one that was actually decent.

At Night Swim Cafe, the menu is a delightful journey for the taste buds. From rich espresso shots to creamy lattes, they've got coffee lovers covered. And for tea enthusiasts, there's a wide selection of aromatic blends. Pair your drink with scrumptious pastries, sandwiches, and heavenly desserts for a perfect anytime indulgence.
Best coffee in town. They take care of their employees.

So very good!!!
Pop tart was the exact balance of flavors, flaky and delicious.Focaccia was one of the best I ever had

The house made syrups truly elevate the coffee experience. Maple cardamom was well balanced and played off the coffee like a perfect chord. Caramel will make you cry with joy.

What a great experience

Insane prices, horrid customer service. Ultra-small portions. And the coffee was way too hot. Burned hot. I can not for the life of me figure out how this chain makes money. I've tried every concept these people own and it's the exact same everywhere. It's the same experience at that undercurrent place in midwood.
Nice coffee shop but understaffed when I've been in. The cashier is also making the drinks, so it's slowwww
great coffee. i can also recommend their roasts

If you ever find yourself in need of an extraordinary coffee experience, look no further than the masterful creations and warm hospitality of Casey, the brilliant barista at a hidden gem of a coffee shop. Words alone cannot do justice to the exceptional skills and delightful personality that Casey brings to every cup.

From the moment you step foot into the cozy cafe, Casey's radiant smile and genuine enthusiasm for coffee will make you feel like an honored guest. Their passion for the craft is infectious, and it becomes evident that each cup they prepare is an artistic masterpiece in its own right.

Casey's expertise in coffee extends far beyond mere technical proficiency. They possess an uncanny ability to understand and cater to the unique preferences of each customer, ensuring that every sip is a personalized delight. Whether you're a fan of robust espressos, velvety cappuccinos, or adventurous signature blends, Casey's repertoire of flavors will leave your taste buds in a state of pure bliss.

But it's not just the exceptional brews that set Casey apart. Their ability to create an inviting and welcoming atmosphere transforms the cafe into a haven where patrons become friends. They effortlessly engage in lively conversations, sharing stories and anecdotes that leave you feeling like part of a larger coffee-loving community.

One of the most remarkable qualities of Casey is their unwavering commitment to quality. They tirelessly seek out the finest beans from around the world, meticulously sourcing only the most ethically and sustainably produced coffee. Their dedication to the craft is palpable in every sip, with each cup bearing the unmistakable mark of excellence.

It's also worth mentioning the sheer creativity that Casey brings to their creations. They are always experimenting with innovative flavor combinations, introducing seasonal specials that keep regulars eagerly anticipating their next visit. Trust me when I say that Casey's menu will continually surprise and enthrall even the most discerning coffee aficionados.

In addition to their exceptional skills, Casey's warm and welcoming demeanor is truly something special. They possess an uncanny ability to brighten even the gloomiest of days with their infectious positivity and genuine care for their customers. No matter how hectic or demanding the coffee shop may get, Casey remains unflinchingly patient and composed, ensuring that everyone receives the perfect cup of coffee and leaves with a smile.

In summary, Casey is not just a barista; they are an artist, a storyteller, and a beacon of warmth and hospitality in the bustling world of coffee. Their unparalleled expertise, coupled with their genuine passion for the craft, make every visit to their cafe an experience to cherish. If you're seeking a truly exceptional coffee journey, allow Casey to guide you through a world of flavors and leave you with memories that will last a lifetime.
Great relaxing atmosphere, and the coffee is delicious.
Came to buy coffee beans and beans are already expensive as it is. And then they've charged us over 17% taxes on top of it. It's ridiculous.
Favorite coffee place In Charlotte. They also have white chocolate cranberry oat cookies that are gluten free and offer gluten free breakfast and lunch items.
This has some of the best coffee in Charlotte. I have been coming here ever since I moved from Stumptown (Portland, OR). The pastries and food is pretty great and I love the vide this place offers.
Good coffee. Kinda pricey.
5star coffe

One of my new favorite places! Smitten with the outdoor landscaping and the quaint, cozy sofa chairs inside. Peppermint tea was superb. I also really cherished that you "soft closed" to give us the gentlest nudge that it was time to wrap up! Time flies in such a pleasant atmosphere.

This location provides excellent coffee options with exceptional ambiance in which you can enjoy your drink of choice. However, the parking lot is a bit tight and is shared with multiple businesses, so be aware that you may not find a spot to park in. Highly recommend this location though as it is easily walkable.

My daughter is a regular here, but it was my first time. I had mentioned to her that I was in the mood for a latte and a bagel, so she drove us here.

The place is super cool and clean. Great atmosphere! But the really impressive thing was the staff. I'm about as high-maintenance as one can get, as far as coffee drinks. First off, I asked if my latte could be decaf. (I've worked in restaurants my whole life and I've done barista work, so I'm familiar with the disdain the service industry has for decaf.) Marlo was the person we were giving out order to. They were very friendly and said sure, as long as it was in an espresso drink and not drip coffee. I'm assuming this meant they have decaf espresso beans but not regular decaf beans. My last restaurant was the opposite, so I get it. I wanted a latte in any case, so I was excited.

I just kept thinking of other things to add or change, like adding their HOUSE-MADE caramel. Two pumps, please. And can I get almond milk? Do you toast your bagels? (Another very popular coffee house that will not be named doesn't toast theirs and I REALLY wanted it toasted.) With every question, Marlo answered without outward rancor, hahaha, and remained friendly and positive. They never once made me feel like a Karen from hell. Delayni (sorry if I butchered the spelling) was equally as nice and friendly, and took my everything bagel to the kitchen pass to be toasted.

My latte and my daughter's black coffee came up quickly, along with a
beautiful bagel and large sides of butter and cream cheese I'd ordered. We sat inside for a few minutes and then decided to move out to the big patio because the weather was so nice.

I will recommend this place to everyone I meet. Just by being nice, the staff got a customer for life. (Sorry, guys, hahaha. I'll try to always come in with my daughter so you get a balance!)
They don't take cash.
Absolutely terrible customer service. Plus the coffee is mids at best. Cashier was pretentious and had some kind of weird attitude

From the moment we walked in we did not feel welcomed.
Ordered three coffees and three bagels. The cashier seemed annoyed with every question.

Received our 2 coffees. The mocha was very chalky. We had to ask about our third coffee and the baristas acted like we were lying. They would not make eye contact and just started whispering to one another. Finally after whispering and not looking at us for 30 seconds they agree to make the coffee.
The coffee is not worth the insanely horrible customer service shown by the baristas 4/24.
*the short dark hair girl who brought out the bagels was the only worker with a smile and positive attitude.
Everyone else made you feel like they would rather be anywhere else but there. Very awkward.
Environment was OK, but maybe a little too modern for a coffee shop. But more importantly, the coffee wasn't very good
delicious spot
Brown sugar vanilla oat milk latte for the win
We enjoyed a cold brew and a vanilla latte--both were so good!
We enjoyed a cold brew and a vanilla latte--both were so good!
Coffee was very good. Ordered breakfast sandwich, it was good but overpriced, was like a mini-sandwhich.
Great service and our barista Lindsey was amazing.

The food and drinks are so good!!! But too trendy to be convenient. Can't call ahead(have to download an app), one size of drink, don't serve food all day (which is terrible because the food is spectacular.)
Stayed here for like 4 hrs working on my laptop and it was a great viiiibe.

Overall, I had a great vibe at Night Swim! Excellent place to work with plenty of tables and chairs. The service was very good and friendly. I would have given them 5 stars, but the iced caramel latte was not my favorite. The caramel sauce tasted a little off to me. I did have the blueberry muffin which was fantastic. I will go back for sure.

Night Swim has the beans...
They roast some of the best coffee beans I've had; you can buy their beans in store for brewing at home. The cafe here has a very cool vibe, light and airy.
The baristas we friendly and quick. I recommend this pace if you want high quality coffee.
Great place to grab a coffee and chill or meet up with friends.
I go here at least once a week. Very fond and quiet atmosphere and the baristas are all really nice and friendly. The food and coffee are exceptional. Strongly recommend.

This is my favorite coffee shop in Charlotte. Any location I go to there is always consistent quality of product and service.
If you appreciate good cup of coffee this is definitely place for you.

It's a cute place to enjoy coffee and something light to eat. I enjoyed a caramel iced latte. I do wish there was more options of baked goods though.

The staff was very helpful in helping with drink choices. I came for the iced tiramisu drink but it was out of season unfortunately it looked so good in the picture.
The crew over at the NightSwim on Oakhurst has been fantastic everytime I go over there. Always getting complicated orders correct and fast! Great work yall.
Absolutely the best coffee in Charlotte in my opinion! The flavor and freshness is amazing. If you love high quality coffee then this is your spot!

This is another great local coffee chain in Charlotte with fantastic drinks and even better staff. I've had some great seasonal espresso drinks that were combined with soda beverages that were very surprising. Definitely a must try.
Great iced chai.
Delicious mocha latte and golden milk latte! Their breakfast options are great and fairly priced.
Great Brown Sugar Vanilla Latte
Very clean & nice decor. Simple layout - great for designer coffee conisueurs. I had their seasonal pumpkin latte. Delicious
Their menu includes a lot of drink options. Iced coffees are amazing, energy and service was wonderful.
Nice cool coffee shop, great cappuccino
Love this place!!! Seriously the best coffee in Charlotte. The maple cardamom syrup us amazing!

Solid coffee shop, great vibes, great service, simple menu.
They also have tasty GF and V treat options.
Plenty of seating to visit or hang out, free wifi. Why leave?

I love exploring coffee shops when I'm in Charlotte and this one has been the best by far! I saw it while I was driving and decided to come back and try it out and I'm so glad I did! The atmosphere was bright and clean and the staff seemed friendly, and the coffee... 10/10! The espresso was amazing and I also got a everything bagel which was just as bomb. So glad I decided to get breakfast here! Will be back
Weekly coffee hangout to get some work done or procrastinating said work enjoying the warm atmosphere
Love this place. The coffee is great and the atmosphere is really pleasant

We tried this coffee shop not too long ago and had a good experience. The first visit we sat in and this visit we ordered to go. We tried two items off of their seasonal menu and they are delicious. When sitting in, your iced items are served in thick glasses with seems like biodegradable straws. I had the iced "Tiramisu'" drink made with oat milk and my daughter had the "Tropic like it's hot" iced drink which includes matcha, mango syrup and some other things top with Tajin seasoning. These both have wonderful flavors so we ordered the same items this visit. The coffee shop is cute and pretty quiet. Service was a tad slow today but there were only 2 people working. I do wish they had an option of size choices but it is all one size.I like the taste of the coffee in my drink so definitely will be going back for a more simple coffee.

Love the outside seating in the mornings. Depending on the day, it's not overwhelmingly busy, a lot of tables to sit, enjoy or work while sipping your drink. Interior music is not loud so it has a great atmosphere to focus if you're not sitting close to the registers. I tried their tiramisu latte for $6.75 this morning and it was very good. Easy parking and fast service. I'd recommend this coffee shop.
Great coffee and a great menu with a variety of dishes
Some of the best coffee in the city! Amazing atmosphere with a great staff. Keep up the amazing work!

I went today at 5:23 to get coffee and the hours of operation say they closed at 6. I don't know if was an race issue just by the way they looked at me and that they  just wanted to leave early but they turned me around right at the door. I will never try this place out again I don't appreciate how I was treated.
They are always out of menu items and they close the kitchen whenever they feel like it. Customer service is a 3 . Sunflour bakery is definitely the better option

First time visiting.  I am always in search of good decaf, but I have to get an Americano because no one really does drip decaf anymore and the Americano  can be hit or miss. This one was a hit-minus. So it had a good flavor, but not as bold as I've gotten at other shops. And it was a wee bitty 8oz cup for $3. Not what I was expecting. But maybe I could have gotten a 12oz it just wasn't advertised.  Glad I tried it.
Nitro cold brew was awesome and they had no problem making a drink that wasn't on the menu.
Great coffee and specialty drinks! Love the atmosphere, workers and location
Very cool spot for coffee and work!

I love this place! Night Swim has great coffee, beautiful interiors, and a really laidback atmosphere. I got a chia latte with oat milk and it was amazing! Chai lattes are usually hit or miss for me and this one was a hit!
Loved the atmosphere, service AND drink! I got the iced Campfire Nights latte with oat milk and was not disappointed. Very smooth.
Amazing nitro brew
Cute lil hipster coffee spot with friendly staff and comfy chairs.
When in there with my husband we were unsure of what the coffee was going to taste like, we both order ice coffee caramel Flavor and it was delicious the best 12$ ever!
Amazing coffee. Great outdoor seating as well.
Had a nice visit, and the coffee was great .
Great place for a more traditional coffee experience. Bright and vibrant with personable staff.
Really good coffee, clean place, nice service. Would go again.

Nice clean coffee shop with a pleasant aesthetic. The latte's come as a double shot and the coffee is smooth and silky goodness. I had a sandwich as well which was toasted and well balanced between veggies, avocados, and turkey and lightly seasoned with herbs and oil. Very good!
Latte was good; chocolate chip cookie was great. Staff was friendly.
Love this place, the environment is so relaxing and the staff is incredible. Always a warm welcome when I enter and all of the food/drinks I have tried are amazing. Love this local spot.

When two of the top 3 coffee shops in Charlotte combine to roast and make a new coffee shop you get pure perfection. Night Swim is incredible. The beans, the brew, the specialty drinks, all of it. No better pure coffee in Charlotte. This location is laid back and great for working if you can get a spot (which I haven't had much of an issue with). Food is... well not the reason to go, but I'm sure you can find something to snack on.
Excellent coffee ! Great new addition to the neighborhood!
Love the lattes (particularly the maple cardamom flavor), friendly customer service, and chill overall vibe. Highly recommend.
much love from the fam at noda yoga!

Tried Night Swim Coffee this morning for the first time and cannot believe how DELICIOUS everything was!! I ordered the maple cardamom latte w almond milk and the breakfast sandwich. Both were, honestly, better than I could have imagined.... What a new gem this place is! I can't wait to come back.

Llegue a este lugar el personal no le importo que estabamos ahi esperando que nos atendieran, ellas estaban haciendo otras cosas menos atender 2 ancianas queriendo tomar cafe con algun pan o postre no tenia nada mas que ofrecer nos fuimos de inmediato del lugar
Breakfast sandwich was really good. It's cool to have a good coffee shop in this part of town
I found a new favorite place! The coffee was delicious, but the Avocado Toast was delicious on another level. So perfect! And they offer gluten free which is a huge plus.
The mocha latte was amazing! Such a rich coffee flavor - not too sweet. Will definitely be back!

Super cute coffee shop. Great place to work and I'm glad they chose this neighborhood. Just don't come here if you're hungry. Food portions are tiny and expensive. They stop serving food early and the breakfast sandwich is the size of my thumb.
Really good true coffee
EXCELLENT CAPPUCCINO and zucchini bread
Cute lil coffee spot! Loved their avocado toast.

Awesome staff, great atmosphere and the best coffee in Charlotte. Love their lattes as well as the amazing variety of fresh roasted coffee to brew at home. Terrific addition to the coffee scene in the southeast!
Really nice atmosphere, airy and light. Coffee is always reliably delicious. Quiche was incredible

Great spot! Super friendly baristas and tasty single origin espresso! super happy to take home a freshly roasted bag of NSC! ....my favorite post-yoga spot (noda yoga is a couple doors down) update, the breakfast sando is mini but sooooo tasty yum. Nice vegetarian options, but would love to see a more seasonal menu

It's ok. They seem to have only one cup size and it's like $8 for it,  which is not bad, but you can easily get a $5-$6 coffee from other places. Plus all the coffee is just super bitter. If you like more sweetness in your coffee you have to add extra caramel, mocha, etc to it to make it taste better but it's cost extra to do so. I've never sat down in the place cause I like my coffee to go but when ordering the atmosphere seems very nice and perfect for hanging out or doing some work. Although this place is not my first choice to get coffee I will still recommend giving it a try.
Interesting atmosphere

Been here 3 times now.
Morning oats are amazing and cravable.
Chocolate chip salted carmel cookies are crazy good.
Coffee is good though each time my cup was just over half full and my $5 menu coffees turn into over $7. I ask for specially milk which menu says is just $.75 but somehow never adds up to $5.75.

on my first sip of your maiden blend my taste buds are filled with excitement!  I love it and it was great meeting Todd when I was in Charlotte last week with my son Tod.  Thank you for these grounds, I'll enjoy them while wishing you and your partner great success.
Not a great menu, doesn't take cash, ridiculously small cups for the price.
I got the iced matcha with oat milk and it was perfect. The desserts looked so yummy and the menu looks good too. Will definitely order food next time.

Staff could be friendlier.  Great coffee they just need to train the staff to be more interactive with the guest.  This is a new shop in Oakhurst, which is a great location but won't last with this staff.

I recently moved to the neighborhood, so I wanted to give them a try. I prefer sticking to smaller, locally owned businesses. They did not disappoint! Super cute atmosphere inside. The gentleman at the counter helped me decide what to order. I settled on their overnight oats. Hands down, the best oats I have ever eaten! I had an oat milk latte, hot. Simple, but delicious, a favorite of mine, so I would be particular. I saw in another review, a complaint about hot drinks in clear glasses? Stating that they won't stay hot? I am a habitually slow drinker. I take forever to sip on a hot drink. On this cold day today, my hot drink had no issues staying hot in the clear glass vessel. And, bonus points, it's super pretty!! As I explore my new neighborhood more, I definitely hope to return to Night Swim.
Delicious! So glad ya'll chose our neighborhood!
Super clean and friendly.  I was so disappointed in the coffee.  It was scalding, and the taste was bitter.  I had to wait 15 mins to even try it it was so hot. I'll be back maybe try something else.
Great new coffee spot for working
Good coffee
Two great teams collaborating to make an awesome shop! Can't wait for their fall festival this Saturday the 20th!
Great coffee great atmosphere
Cute coffee shop, but outrageous prices. $3.00 for a 12oz drip and $5.00 for a regular latte? Bonkers.
This place is too expensive for what it is. Hella greasy and portion size is super small! If you want a better place for coffee and breakfast go to Queen City Grounds or Eastside local eatery.

Good food and drinks, but weird that they serve hot drinks in clear glasses. Clear glasses do not hold heat. I understand for an iced coffee, but not a hot drink. They should rethink how they serve their beverages to the correct style glass or mug.
Super cute new spot. Simple menu, cheap coffee, and quick service!
Pretty much another Not Just Coffee installation but that's a good thing.  Coffee is excellent with a nice patio area when weather is good.

Visited Night Swim on their grand opening and the coffee was very good. The food looked like it was sold out when we got there, but we were happy to try out their coffee. The coffee shop was very nice and clean. It has a very modern simplistic vibe and has a lot of seating to sit anywhere inside or outside. I would definitely come back here again.
Great service and nice clean atmosphere. Food was sold out when we got there. Coffee and tea was watered down... we might try again later after any kinks are ironed out.
Great coffee, nice atmosphere and love the iced cortado
Love their chai and matcha latte! We got the breakfast sandwich that was delish. Highly recommend

Attended Night Swim's grand opening today. Such a beautiful Cafe in a spot that is underserved. Stop in for great third wave coffee served expertly by talented baristas. Espresso and chai tea were wonderful, and the chocolate chip cookie was absolutely ridiculous. Can't wait to go back!

Great space. Great coffee. Great service.

They have some pastries as well as a small cafe menu.
